iati-activity.description: PROJECT AIMS AT DIMINISHING RURAL POVERTY ESPECIALLY AMONG WOMEN.

iati-activity.title: PROAGRI II
iati-activity.description: PROAGRI II IS THE SECOND PHASE OF A GOVERNMENT OF MOZAMBIQUE PROGRAM THAT WILL COVER THE CALENDAR YEARS 2005 TILL 2009. IT CONTRIBUTES TO POVERTY REDUCTION AND IMPROVED FOOD SECURITY

iati-activity.title: CAPACITY BUILDING OF THE BUDGET SUPPORT IN MOZAMBIQUE
iati-activity.description: FINLAND JOINED THE DONORS GIVING BUDGET SUPPORT IN MOZAMBIQUE IN JUNE 2003. SINCE THE BUDGET SUPPORT USES NATIONAL SYSTEMS IT IS VULNERABLE TO THE WEAKNESSES OF THESE SYSTEMS. THEREFORE IT IS NECESSARY TO SUPPORT PROGRAMMES WHICH AIM TO STRENGHTEN THE FIN

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / School of the Teachers of the Future, Nhamatanda
iati-activity.description: Establish a Teacher Training College and start education programme

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Mozambique Deaf Education Development Project, Phase II
iati-activity.description: Continuation of the Pilot I phase. Consolidating the Pilot Phase I results into the Ministry of Education and Culture, Mozambique. Trainers of Mozambican Sign Language will be trained to resource persons in MEC; for teachers of one special institution arranged courses in MSL.

iati-activity.title: Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Maputo
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs at MFA, related to ODA. These costs cover all costs that can be counted (in full or percentually) as ODA at the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in Finland. Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Maputo

iati-activity.title: Pre-Service Education of Primary School Teachers
iati-activity.description: Pre- and in-service training of primary school teachers and alleviate poverty by community development

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Vocational Training and Employment Project in Mozambique
iati-activity.description: Provide vocational training and create possibilities for employment to youth with intellectual and developmental disabilities.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Nampula Teacher Training College
iati-activity.description: Establish a new Teacher Training College in Nampula province. Construction of the school buildings_ provision of furniture_ devises and materials_ the education programme and curriculum development.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Nampula Province Rural Water Supply_ Sanitation and Hygiene Promotion
iati-activity.description: The Project contributes to the improved health status of 120 000 people through the establishment of sustainable community based water supply_ sanitation and hygiene promotion services.
iati-activity.sector: Education and training in water supply and sanitation

iati-activity.title: Mozambique_ Support to National Forest Programme
iati-activity.description: Support to the National Forestry Program in Mozambique_ 2009-2014. The aim of the support is Forest sector capacity strengthened to address the challenges of sustainable management of forests and wildlife as a contribution for poverty reduction_ income generation and climate change adaptation and mitigation.

location.name: Mozambique; provinces of Nampula_ Niassa_ Cabo Delgado and Zambezia

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Strengthening Disaster Risk Management Capacity. To strengthen the disaster risk reduction and response capacity of civil society and government partners as well as Plan Mozambique and enable communities at the high-risk areas to become more disaster resilient.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Local Action Group of Alto Ligonha
iati-activity.description: Aim: foster bottom-up rural development and good governance; improve income possibilities and diversify income generating activities; enhance micro-projects. Activities: establishing and strengthening the local level structures for civil society participation in decission making and governance; visits to Finland to similar projects in rural areas.

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (KEPA), general activities
iati-activity.description: Frame Agreement with NGO (KEPA), part that is allocated in Mozambique

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finnish Red Cross)
iati-activity.description: Health and Care in the Community. To improve the lives and the general health and sanitation conditions of vulnerable communities through the promotion of the community based health care and water and sanitation activities.

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finnish Red Cross)
iati-activity.description: Integrated Food Security and Disaster Preparedness. Integrated food security and DP programme

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
iati-activity.description: Gaza Integrated Rural Development Project. Empower households and communities to advocate for their rights to food, water and adequate standard of living. Strengthen community based structures to effectively mobilize, exploit and manage their resources:

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
iati-activity.description: Womenâs Rights and Prevention of HIV/AIDS. Advocating for womenâs rights, facilitating establishment of community based groups and organizations, facilitating savings and credit schemes and facilitating home-based care for terminally ill.

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
iati-activity.description: Capacity Building . Ensure appropriate and adequate staff competence to carry out the Country Strategy 2010-2015, develop comprehensive fund raising strategy, strengthen management structures, systems and accountability etc.
iati-activity.sector: Support to local and regional NGOs

iati-activity.title: Mozambique - expert in national administrative systems
iati-activity.description: The project (an expert) aims at increasing transparency in public financial management and decreasing corruption in Mozambique. The purpose is to support and strengthen financial management reforms, especially the electronic financial management system e- sistafe and the broad- based taxreform. The aim is also to strengthen and promote national financial systems in aid delivery. The project aims at increasing Mozambican capacity in public financial management.

iati-activity.title: Support to the Institute of Social and Economic Research
iati-activity.description: The project (Finnish support to IESE) aims to support the implementation of the national poverty reduction strategy PARPA II through supporting independent, high- level, cross- sectoral socio- economical research. Dissemination of conducted research is done through seminars, conferences and training. Through supporting IESE Finland contributes to the development of mozambican research capacity and dialogue, as well as supports research of Mozambique conducted in Mozambique.

iati-activity.title: Programme of Cooperation in Science,Technology and Innovation STIFIMO
iati-activity.description: The programme supports practical implementation of Mozambican science, technology and innovation strategy (MOSTIS)as well as the development of sectoral programme for donors within the area of science, technology and innovations.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mozambique
iati-activity.description: Communicative English Training on Ilha de MoÃ§ambique for Tourism Sector. The project aims at:1. Enhancing english communication skills of local people (especially women) to improve their possibilities for work opportunities and self-employment withing the growing tourist industry on Ilha de MoÃ§ambique and in Djembesse (continental area where many Ilha workers reside) 2. Creating capacity of the local teacher to train new teacher in communicative mehtods in order to carry out english courses and apply adequate teaching matierial on Ilha de MoÃ§ambique and expand the teachin are to continent.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mozambique
iati-activity.description: Setting up of higher education in Theatre. The project aims at the establishment of a high course in theatre at University Eduardo Mondlane, including capacity building of the university in terms of curriculum development, acquisition of equipment and bibliography, admission selection exams, training teachers, etc.. This is a continuation of previous projects and the main objectives are:- training of theatre actores, stage diretors, play writers and teachers capacity building - enrich the curltural inheritance and create a base for future works through the development of theatre as an art.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mozambique
iati-activity.description: Breaking the chains of prison - Ressocialization of ex-convicts. Project aims at the ressocialization of ex-convicts through: Empowerment of human capital, consisting of providing vocational training to ex convicts as well as psico-social support to families and community Advocacy of human rights instruments about the treatment of children and women in prison among prison officers in charge of penal execution. After FLC support, the project is expected to become self-sustainable by generating income revenue resulting from vocational training activities.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mozambique
iati-activity.description: Fertiliza Centre (recycling of organic urban residues into compost). The project aims at: - supporting Fertiliza Centre to become self-sustainable and - expanding environmental sensibilization and education to the population living in the periphery of Maputo. The Fertiliza Centre is a centre which recycles organic urban residues into compost being a valuable contribution to the efforts of Maputo municipality in managment of urban residues thus contributing to reduce endemic diseases like cholera and malaria.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mozambique
iati-activity.description: Capacity Building of the Parliament. This project is part of a much larger programme of capacity building of Mozambican parliament. The main objectives are to: - consolidate and improve knowledge, understanding and skills necessary to fulfil parliamentary duties amongst MPs - improve parliamentary support staff capacity. It is expected that a visit to Finnish parliament to exchange experiences will be organized.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mozambique
iati-activity.description: Environmental education for sustainable management of natural resources. The main objectives of the project is to: - promote envirnmental education of communities for the knowledge of ecological, environmental, social economical value of the ecosystem of the Maputoland in Matutuine district - promote the production of nurseries and planing of fruit trees for the improvement of diet and as an income generation.

iati-activity.title: ICI project; Building Innovation Management Capacities at UEM (InnoUEM)
iati-activity.description: The objective of the project is to build and develop capacity to manage innovation among UEM staff and students; to develop innovation management and STI curriculum programme together with UEM to be implemented in the future; and to improve the electronic and distance learning facilities at UEM to teach STI courses.

iati-activity.title: Farmers Club project trains 3200 farmers to enable them to be self sufficient in food production
iati-activity.description: The project aims at developing human capacity of the farmers of Maringue and Gorongoza districts in central province of Sofala to enable to create food security and to manage their natural resources more effectively. The goal of the project is to train 3200 farmers to enable them to be self sufficient in food production and thus reduce their poverty levels and dependency of food from outsice the district.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mozambique
iati-activity.description: A nutrition study to research teenaged girls nutritional habits in the province of Zambesia in Mozambique. The main activities are: capacity building for nutrition intake research for Mozambican researchers, collection of information about alimentation situation and habits among target group, to arrange training visit for Mocambican researchers, analyse the collected information and presentation to authorities responsible for nutrition policies and food security.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mozambique
iati-activity.description: Detailed initial study for zoning and mapping of eatable mushrooms in Mozambique

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mozambique
iati-activity.description: The project aims at supporting MISA in their monitoring of freedom of press in Mozambique, capacity building of media officer in lobbying and advocacy and also support provincial nucleous so that monitoring of freedom of press can be done nation wide
iati-activity.sector: Media and free flow of information

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mozambique
iati-activity.description: This is the last phase of a project started in 2006 to set up the first university degree in theatre at the School of Communication and Arts from University Eduardo Mondlane. This degree is to professionally train theatre actors and directors.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mozambique
iati-activity.description: Unallocated. Will be allocated in 2010.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Youth empowerment through arts and media

iati-activity.title: Business linkage programme (Finnpartnership)
iati-activity.description: Long term partnership with a local company / organisation (e.g. joint venture; subcontractor, import or other contract agreement )

iati-activity.description: Long term partnership with a local company / organisation (e.g. joint venture; subcontractor, import or other contract agreement )
